title: Can we STOP with the mass lies about zoe?
body:
we get it. she is annoying. But these posts of misinformation about her needs to stop and people need to stop encouraging it. 

"zoe has no counterplay" BS literally buy a veil and she will get assblasted

"her skill shots are easy to land" BS

"everyone can see her W stars and it reveals my location in jg" high caliber BS. no one, including zoe, gets vision of her orbs unless they already had vision of it dropping.

"she is rewarded for playing bad" BS, otherwise her winrate would be alot higher than 46%, kind of like MF. you know the champion who just presses R and displaces an entire team even if it misses because if you go anywhere near it you will die? ya kind of like that.

"there is zero risk to playing her" Bull and shit. Have you tried ganking her? she is very easy to gank considering she has no escape outside the RNG of her W which she does not take untill level 3 anyway. Like seriously, she is very easy to gank if she over extends even a little bit. 

Seriously, she does not deserve the hate she is getting considering champs like MF and twitch still have zero nerfs in sight and has  gameplay patterns 100x more cancerous.

replies.body:
I remember one of my first few games with a Zoe...

Morg support, level 8, Zoe was probably level 10, I was coming to mid. Zoe pops up in front of me and a shot came flying to my face. Went down to 20% of my hp remaining, while initially full. There goes my 2 seconds in the lane trying to help! Already had to turn around and start recalling.

Tried her for the first time. Her shots aren't so easy to land, but with practice (and hopefully less than 200 ping), you'll get a hang of it.

Many people banned her because people regularly ban newly released champions, as they either don't want to vs something they're not familiar with, or they don't want someone who is inexperienced in the champ to try it out for the first time in their match. Lots of people want to play her, because newly released champs often feel over powered on release, and because she's paired with a lovely 1000 experience mission (which I have still yet to complete lol).
So... you're upset because a burst mage burst you down?
Burst mages burst with their ultimate not with a 2 second cooldown ability...

I mean, you can get about 8 seconds on {{champion:99}}'s. Considering one is a 1-second LeBlanc W with no damage attached and the other is a giant nuke, I think the cooldown on it isn't really the issue.

Which is why I am abusing Lux right now with Ultimate Hat, but if it weren't for that she would have around 20-ish seconds tops on her burst. On the other hand Zoe's Q is  2-3 seconds late game and her E is like 6 seconds with a reduction if it hits. Its not nearly fucking comparable, not to mention that Lux  CC is much shorter range and harder to land.

> [{quoted}](name=DoktorKaiser,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=loAWKRAj,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-14T05:58:38.202+0000) 
On the other hand Zoe's Q is  2-3 seconds late game and her E is like 6 seconds with a reduction if it hits. Its not nearly fucking comparable, not to mention that Lux  CC is much shorter range and harder to land.

Considering Lux's Q has almost 400 range on Zoe's E without Wallcasting, hits two targets, has a wider hitbox *and* also has about a 6s cooldown at max CDR, yeah, it is actually pretty comparable.

Why wouldn't you cast Zoe's E through the wall when it covers literally half the fucking map that way?  That also means that you will probably have advantage of casting it from fog of war, also it leaves a huge trap for some reason which either zones the enemy team or someone else will get hit anyway. Not to even mention that Lux Q is far easier to dodge due to missile speed so its very hard to actually engage with it the way Zoe can just snipe CC someone and start a teamfight. Hitting 2 people who aren't trash at the game and aren't already CC-ed or clustered in a teamfight is also near impossible.

I'm not sure how you got the idea of me being upset from my comment. I was just sharing my first experience against a Zoe, my first experience playing her, and listed reasons why people might ban her.

So, you're a Morg player who doesn't have the common sense to shield yourself before charging face first at Zoe?  Sounds like the game is working as intended...

Morg absolutely wrecks Zoe 1v1.

It was my first time ever walking up to a Zoe, and IIRC, that was WITH a shield. Granted I didn't build full AP or put too many points into shield, as 1, I'm playing support, and 2, I generally go for longer snares as opposed to a magic shield... cuz you know, an anti-magic shield won't protect your adc against arrows, bullets, and swords. I wasn't charging at her, in fact, I was still behind the turret making my way towards mid when she popped up and dropped the bomb on me.  If I were playing mid and laning with Zoe from the start, it would have been a completely different scenario.

Faker even has said that Zoe is the best champion in League atm and hopes she is nerfed soon.

Of course, he's  only one of the best players in the world, what does he know about balance...

amarite?
High elo play is a *completely* different animal than low elo. Something can be trash below master and broken as hell above.

Something could also be trash high elo and a pub stomper in low elo. Thats not a balance issue though. Thats a mechanics/player skill issue.

It might take awhile for the lower elos to catch up on exploiting Zoe's kit (she's a new champ) because of the learning curve of pros vs casuals. OP may think shes not broken but when people catch up learning her strengths they might be singing a different tune in the future if her kit goes unchecked.

Daily reminder that "dude just buy X" is always a non-argument. If any champion has a kit that requires a very specific item to deal with, that's automatically an indication that that champion's kit is poorly made.

Zoe's only part of her kit that is overpowered is her Q mana cost(which can be justified tbh) and her E.


Zoe's E has a heavy slow + full 2 seconds of sleep + damage amp + Trap that applies same effects on one ability.


There are only a few champions that have an ult that does what Zoe E does.

I'll admit Zoe E is weaker than those ultimates( numbers-wise) but Zoe E is up more often than those ultimates which is what makes it overpowered.


Zoe doesn't really have an ultimate, so it makes sense to give her a larger pool of damage with basic abilities.

The problem arises when Zoe is able to burst as well as an Artillery mage while having hardly the same mana problems thanks to her E.


Zoe's Q is mostly fair. Strong during laning and in the midgame, but when lategame teamfights roll around Zoe Q is going to fall off in usefulness by itself.


Then Zoe's E comes along and makes her Q just as scary as it is in the laning phase.

Zoe's E makes her Chunk tanks mid-lategame thanks to the true damage portion of the move.

Zoe's E(combined with Q and R) make her an amazing roaming support, roaming mid, and an interesting jungler, but Zoe's E is overpowered due to how much it does at once.



The Zoe E base damage needs to be gutted and her E AP scaling needs to be buffed.

I am saving up BE for Zoe because toplane bruiser Zoe build is going to be as powerful(give/take) as the Ekko, Fizz, and Leblanc tank builds that popped up last season!!!

Zoe's EQ does 1/3 of most mage's health(when both are fully maxed so lvl 11) with BASE DAMAGE!!!!

That's a pretty big problem!!!

Zoe's risk factor also is reduced because of her W RNG.

It's always a positive effect that has too big of a catch range and lasts 20 seconds on the ground...

Most mages at level 3 cannot do more damage than Zoe's Q so they can't stop her very easily from grabbing anything that falls on the ground.
